transportAdvice: Beirut has no metro or tram system, but an informal network of shared minibuses and taxis covers most of the city; taxis are widely available and negotiating fares in advance is common practice. Central districts and the waterfront are walkable, though traffic congestion and uneven infrastructure make some areas less pedestrian-friendly.

weather.description: Cool and wet with frequent rain showers; the coldest month of the year for Beirut.
Still cool and rainy with occasional storms; snow is possible in nearby mountains.
Temperatures begin to rise and rain becomes less frequent as spring approaches.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and mostly sunny skies.
Warm and largely dry; a comfortable month for sightseeing and outdoor dining.
Hot and sunny with very little rain; humidity begins to build along the coast.
Peak summer heat with high coastal humidity; evenings remain lively and warm.
The hottest and most humid month; expect intense heat during the day.
Still hot and humid but temperatures gradually ease toward the end of the month.
Comfortable autumn temperatures with occasional early rains returning late in the month.
Cooler and wetter as autumn deepens; a quieter and pleasant time to visit.
Cool and rainy with a festive atmosphere in the city; similar in character to January.
